name: Side split squats right
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet wide apart with one foot forward (in this case, the right foot).
2. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, bend your front knee until it's almost touching the ground.
3. Stretch your arms out to the side for balance and lower your body down into a lunge position while keeping your back leg as straight as possible.
4. Keep your weight on both legs and push back up to standing, maintaining stability throughout the movement.
5. Perform the desired number of repetitions, alternating sides with each rep.
short_summary: The side split squat is an effective lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes and hip flexors while maintaining good form.
